title: Why does the system only use chat logs from 2 games for permaban now?
body:
I've had two permabanned accounts since August, and in both times, there were only 2 games used to determine I was toxic enough for a ban. I remember it used to be 3. Now they send me one game where I'm mildly toxic, and another where I'm extremely toxic, but being egged on by another teammate flaming and making the game itself harder on me. 

When did we decide 2 games was enough to take an account away from someone that they've had for years? Especially when my last 14 day ban was months and months ago and haven't been chat restricted since.

replies.body:
>I've had two permabanned accounts 

Instead of complaining about the system, have you considered trying to be less toxic?

If I'm remembering this right, if your chat logs are too long, they won't send all three. But you can contact support if you want further chat logs from games that you received punishment for.

The system is a problem. There should be no way for you to have a permabanned account without a human at least looking over the logs. Automated temp bans/chat restrictions are fine. If you're going to permanently close someone's account, you don't leave a program in charge of it.

I'd say I seriously let someone have it in about 10% of my games. Usually because they've either stopped trying to win entirely and are making the game hell for 4 other people, or are in a flame war with me. Sure I could mute them, and often times I do.

Take a look at these logs.. One of which was from a week ago where my jungle full clears twice despite asking him for help to come clear the freeze. Full clearing twice as zac is basically ensuring your team loses the early game hard. The other from earlier today where I got into a flame war with a Master Tier gragas who stopped trying to win by endlessly farming jungle and taking the buffs then walking into enemy team.

> [{quoted}](name=xXZiluenXx,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=X0E0ZZ32,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-12-29T10:34:01.194+0000)

> what you are forgetting to mention is the automated system is also based on the numbder of reports as well which detemermines ther severity of the punishment as well as how quick it happens

Incorrect, It is not based on number of reports per match. it is based on number of **_matches with valid reports, the severity of the offense commited, and the frequency in which the player is caught behaving in such ways. As well as the current punishment tier the player is on, and how recent they just received that punishment/finished it _**

1 report = 9 reports, and soliciting reports from others against another player is reportable in and of it self for griefing and harassment.

As Prandine mentioned:  Reports only **flag a game for review**

> [{quoted}](name=xXZiluenXx,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=X0E0ZZ32,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-12-29T10:34:01.194+0000)
>
> what you are forgetting to mention is the automated system is also based on the numbder of reports as well which detemermines ther severity of the punishment as well as how quick it happens

That is not true. The number of reports don't matter as all it takes is one report to flag a game for review.  From [Riot Tantram](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/H67KxUT6-about-chat-restriction?comment=000000000002): 

>Actually, Erdrik is correct here.

>A report flags a game for review. They do not establish guilt. The game is then reviewed for harassment, feeding, etc. This is why 'troll reporting' or 'gang reporting' do not work. False or inaccurate reports are thrown out.

>You cannot ever be punished for saying nothing .. unless of course it's for something gameplay related like feeding, afking or cheating. But, you can never be punished for offensive language, hate speech or verbal abuse if you said nothing.

As for severity, that all depends on ones behavior. Things like death threats, racist comments and hate speech as well as gameplay trolling and intentional feeding/afking will result in a 2-week or permanent ban while lesser chat offenses such as general harassment and report calling will go through the punishment system as normal.

For the OP, Reform Cards always show 1-3 games that you were valid reported in. I'd say that it's just coincidence that in both of your permaban cases there were only 2 games shown.
That's not true at all. The number of reports means literally nothing. 1 report is just as effective as 9 for getting a game flagged for review.
That's a terrible system in place. Let's group queues have too much power.

autoban system is fine for chat bans. Any game ban should be moderated by a Riot employee. If that's too much for them to handle, then don't permanently ban players for abusing the chat system. Restrict their chat indefinitely. I can guarantee with only 10-15 messages to send a game, the vast majority of toxic players, including myself, won't use the chat system to flame.

If you had a 14 day ban, that's Riot telling you you're absolutely on your last chance. You're supposed to be a model citizen from then on. Anything that would trigger so much as a 10-game chat restriction at that point gets you banned instead. 

With two entirely banned accounts in the past five months, I'd have thought you'd have figured that out by now.

I understand how their system in place works. This was my second account banned. If their expectations are for someone who has a history of a bad temper/easily egged on by others to be a model citizen in 100/100 games they play, then they're going to be auto-banning a lot of people until the system is changed. I can gladly say this will be the last day I take this game seriously. After 4+ years I'll only play to play 5s with friends. Riot clearly prioritizes banning the 'toxic' players who flame the people who troll ranked games, over the trolls themselves. Time for post secondary school anyways, better off not wasting any more time on this beta cuck game.

>If their expectations are for someone who has a history of a bad temper/easily egged on by others to be a model citizen in 100/100 games they play, then they're going to be auto-banning a lot of people until the system is changed

Riot _doesn't want_ toxic people that ruin the game for others to continue playing their game. If after 3 punishments you still haven't realized that what you're doing isn't okay, _they don't want you to play the game_. You're bad for their business.

But ruining the game by intentionally doing things to lose your team the game, by running down mid, or following people around the entire game is ok? I agree, toxic players should be banned. But it has to be a two-way street.

They get banned, too. It's just harder for the system to pick that up, because they don't want to ban people for being bad. It's easier to see somebody like you calling people a slur than it is to determine whether the 2/15 Ryze is actively trolling or just has no idea what he's doing.

If you're going to be permanently closing someone's account, wouldn't it be a good idea to have a human look over the cases individually? Maybe go into a replay of the game and see what enticed this behaviour? I can promise I don't go into every game thinking 'yeah I'm gonna call this gragas a f****t today and tell him hope his parents get cancer'.

The reason is irrelevant. You're responsible for your own actions.
If someone tailgates you for 10 miles, then you get out of your car and punch him in the face, you're the one that's going to get in trouble.
Running down mid or trolling isn't okay either. Both are punishable. Just because you don't personally see that they get banned, doesn't mean that they don't.

Do you guys not think a permanent chat restriction feature should be added for players who can't seem to stop abusing the chat system? Or are we content just preventing passionate players from playing the game entirely. Whenever I'm chat restricted, which hasn't been for many months, I always find I'm using the chat purely for game talk. I'll even stop myself from flaming because I know I will want to use the message for something constructive later on.

it depends on your overall punishment history. 

If you were toxic right away after you get off your punishment, the system would deem you to be "unreformable" and instantly punish you. Even if you just played one game. 

If you played a bunch of games without being toxic, the system will be a little bit more lenient and  let you get away with one game of toxicity.

I'm happy I got banned, it's more motivation to focus on my upcoming studies in January. Hope you all have a happy holidays, you f****ts!
